jobDescription: About Marvell At Marvell, we believe that infrastructure powers progress. That execution is as essential as innovation. That better collaboration builds better technology. Trusted by the world’s leading technology companies for 25 years, we move, store, process and secure the world’s data with semiconductor solutions designed for our customers’ current needs and future ambitions. Through a process of deep collaboration and transparency, we’re ultimately changing the way tomorrow’s enterprise, cloud, automotive, and carrier architectures transform—for the better. The data infrastructure that our customers build has never been more critical to our global economy. It’s what’s keeping the world connected, businesses running, and information flowing. If you’re ready to excel, innovate, and truly enjoy your work, apply now for the position detailed below. The Opportunity Marvell’s Central Engineering team is seeking an Advanced Package Technology intern to contribute to the development of advanced microelectronic packages supporting up to 224 Gb/s data rates. The intern will work within a multi-disciplinary team dedicated to developing new and advanced package technologies needed for next generation of Marvell products. Tasks will include measurements and model correlation for transmission lines on advanced substrate materials, automation of material properties extraction, and reliability testing of advanced packaging technology under development. Candidate must be currently enrolled in an accredited university in an undergraduate or graduate degree program with an interest and aptitude to work in Electrical Engineering and technical communications. Job Responsibilities S-parameter measurements of packaging samples up to 125GHz Analysis of measured data to extract material electrical properties and create correlated models Reliability characterization of novel advanced packaging technologies Requirements Candidate MUST be currently pursuing a MS/PhD degree in CE/EE or related technical fields Graduating within 1.5-year The Perks With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page. Your Future Marvell provides a work environment that promotes employee growth and development. We are searching for an individual who wants to grow with the company and will strive to improve performance. The Opportunity The Security Solutions Business Unit (SSBU) is developing products to protect data (in motion and at rest), authentication and key management in public/private clouds and large enterprises and is currently hiring for a Senior Staff Security Engineer to join their team. Marvell LiquidSecurity Hardware Secure Module (HSM) Adapters are the industry’s first and only FIPS 140-2 level 3 certified solution designed to be deployed in hyperscale cloud environments. They offer the highest HSM performance and scalability, as well as the remote management and resiliency required for the intense workloads and environmental conditions of the cloud datacenters where they are deployed. We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most. That’s why we’re a leader in cloud HSM (Hardware security modules) —and why many of the major cloud providers trust us as a security partner. Job Responsibilities In this role you will: Develop crypto agile architecture to meet future requirements. Define policies for selecting algorithms and mechanisms for industry standard protocols. To design, implement and integrate key management and crypto acceleration, particularly for cloud native solutions. Debug and diagnose customer reported issues. The Central System Engineering (CSE), a group in Central Engineering, is responsible for validation and application engineering support of high-speed SerDes and analog macros for electrical and optical applications. The team also develops data communication system hardware infrastructure to for large-scale automation to deliver the highest quality SerDes IP and analog macros for Marvell. Job Responsibilities As an Associate Vice President (AVP) you will be responsible for a large multi-disciplinary team of high-speed SerDes and analog macros validation engineers, high-frequency and high-precision power HW system engineers and SW architect and low-level driver design. The scope of responsibility includes engineering development as well as budget management for the team. The validation team is responsible for bring-up, debug and characterization of block level performance of AFE (analog front end), ADC, DAC, PLL/DLL, etc. as well as system validation of various supported standards compliance such as PCIe, Ethernet, Fiber Channel, etc. The SW team delivers API’s to the Business Units to integrate CE SerDes in the SoC products. The HW team is responsible for high-speed evaluation platform to the validation team as well as evaluation kits for customers. You will be required to work with other senior managers in Central Engineering on product development strategy, resource planning and budget proposals. The position will enable you to participate in the definition of new products, identification of areas that present new opportunities for Marvell as well as make new product recommendations to Design/Marketing teams at Marvell. Through a process of deep collaboration and transparency, we’re ultimately changing the way tomorrow’s enterprise, cloud, automotive, and carrier architectures transform—for the better. The data infrastructure that our customers build has never been more critical to our global economy. It’s what’s keeping the world connected, businesses running, and information flowing. If you’re ready to excel, innovate, and truly enjoy your work, apply now for the position detailed below. The Opportunity Marvell embedded processors are custom designed to deliver optimal performance, low power, and high levels of integration. The Marvell ARMv7 compliant CPU cores are the most advanced implementations of the industry standard ARM architecture and deliver exceptional processing performance at low power. Advanced system architecture design and years of experience in sub‐micron mixed signal technology seamlessly implement processor cores with our wide selection of high speed interfaces to precisely meet the needs of each application. Marvell embedded processors are Industrial Grade which can operate between ‐40°C to +105°C. Job Responsibilities Learning the basic architecture of high speed serdes interfaces Contribute to the electrical characterization of serdes interfaces in a large SOC using Realtime Oscilloscopes, Vector Network Analyzers and BertScopes. Realtime Oscilloscopes are used to analyze serdes transmitter eye parameters for proper signal integrity and jitter performance. Vector Network Analyzers are used for evaluating TX and RX return loss as well as for characterizing test channels over frequency. Bertscopes are used for evaluating the serdes receiver for it's tolerance to additive jitter and noise. Learn the fundamentals of high speed PCB design for use with Serdes electrical characterization. Requirements Candidate MUST be currently pursuing a BS/MS (preferred) degree in EE or related technical field(s) 0-1 years of previous experience The Perks With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page. Your Future Marvell provides a work environment that promotes employee growth and development. We are searching for an individual who wants to grow with the company and will strive to improve performance. If you are driven, personable, and energetic, there will be additional opportunities for you here at Marvell. At Marvell, we are doing our part to help keep our communities and our teams safe. As part of our efforts to address the Covid pandemic and future epidemics, you may be required at any time by our policies or applicable laws to provide proof of applicable vaccination or to present negative test results. The Opportunity At Marvell’s Processor Business Unit (PBU), we develop and design the processors that move, process and secure the world's data faster and more reliably than anyone else. We are looking to add talented people to the system firmware team - working on the system firmware for Marvell OCTEON DPU product family. As a member of the firmware team, the candidate will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining various firmware components of the Marvell OCTEON DPU management sub-system. Job Responsibilities Design and develop the firmware for Marvell OCTEON DPU management sub-system based on RTOS or Bare-metal. Design and develop software/firmware for the Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) based on OpenBMC or RTOS. Implement the platform management communication protocol for the management sub-system and the board management controller. Work with qualification team to test the system firmware by writing the test cases and help on the CI/CD development. Support the release of the management sub-system firmware to Marvell SoC customers. Requirements Candidate MUST be currently pursuing a BS/MS (preferred) degree in CS/EE or related technical field(s) Understanding the fundamentals of the CPU architecture. Understanding the fundamentals of the Operating System. Knowledge and expertise with C programming language. Familiarity with Linux Distros such as Ubuntu as a development machine. Understanding of the hardware schematics and the interconnections between different hardware components. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. The Opportunity Central Engineering ASIC Design Services in Marvell designs and develops complex, custom chips for external customers in market segments ranging from artificial intelligence and machine learning to wired and wireless infrastructure. The Design-for-Test (DFT) team is a global team that impacts chip design from inception all the way to manufacturing production. Rigorous DFT methods ensure that a part can be tested with an extremely high degree of defect coverage in a time-constrained manufacturing environment, directly impacting product quality and customer satisfaction. The ideal candidate will possess both digital logic design and verification skills along with software development and programming skills. Such a candidate will enjoy an opportunity that spans disciplines and involves them in all aspects of semiconductor chip design. Job Responsibilities Develop understanding of the block level or chip top design-for-test (DFT) and automated test pattern generation (ATPG) flows for complex custom ASIC designs Execute DFT insertion and verification flows for scan test, Memory Built-in Self-Test (MBIST), and IP macro test Execute digital logic, MBIST, and IP test pattern generation and simulation flows Requirements Pursuing a Bachelor of Science or advance degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related fields Demonstrable programming skills with C/C++, TCL/MySQL, or Perl/Python in Unix type environment, with good problem-solving skills Good understanding of Linux/Unix, with experience working on multi-threaded systems Effective teamwork and communication skills Knowledge of scan-based logic test, memory BIST/BISR, functional test, JTAG, and other test methodologies is helpful The Perks With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. The Opportunity Marvell is focused on data infrastructure covering four key segments: Carrier, Enterprise campus, Cloud and enterprise data centers and Automotive. Today’s bandwidth-intensive online lifestyle—from cloud-centric networks to streaming video—requires high-performance with uncompromised quality. Legacy broadband is based on copper infrastructures such as DSL, an aging technology with high maintenance costs that is running out of bandwidth. Optical access is now taking stage to better address the demands of these networks. Marvell’s optical broadband AVANTA™ family features highly integrated solutions that leverage key Marvell technologies—PON, Ethernet and packet processing, voice processing, power management, and application processors. AVANTA SoCs also include special power management modes that reduce power based on usage and coupled with latest Alaska® Gigabit PHYs support the EEE standard. Marvell’s focus on cloud data center connectivity solution enabled our customer to move data inside and between cloud data center faster and more reliably. The PAM4 DSP technology enabled 200G, 400G and 800G data transfer rate within the data centers. The Coherent DSP technology enabled 100G and 400G data transfer rate between data centers. Marvell is the enabler and partner of world’s leading cloud hyper scalers in area of transferring data from Copper PHY to the world of Optics. Job Responsibilities As an engineer in the Product Engineering organization at Marvell, you will be part of a brilliant growing team of engineers that solves complex problems. Collaborate with NPI PE, Test, Foundry and Reliability Engineering teams to drive NPI development of highspeed datacenter products and their variants.
